report_title: Power Conversion Equipment Manufacturing Industry Report
executive_summary: Power conversion equipment manufacturers have experienced revenue volatility because of fluctuating growth in downstream markets. Fluctuations in the value of the US dollar have also contributed to volatility by destabilizing demand for imports and exports. Construction companies use the industry's products as inputs in their daily operations, so when this downstream activity increases, so does demand for power conversion equipment. Nonresidential construction and industrial production plunged during COVID-19 as the economy shut down, hindering revenue growth. Despite these factors, low interest rates buoyed demand from households, so revenue still inched upward in 2020. As the effects of the pandemic subsided, revenue recovered because of rising corporate profit and consumer spending. The return of employees to the office caused nonresidential to soar in 2023, fostering significant revenue growth in that year.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The performance of the industrial sector is key for power conversion equipment manufacturers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Performance for this industry often tracks with the strength of the industrial sector since purchases from manufacturers comprise a decent chunk of revenue.

When COVID-19 hit, social distancing measures reduced capacity in industrial facilities and caused demand for many manufactured products to fall, resulting in a decline in revenue. As mass vaccination enabled the US economy to reopen, consumer spending soared as households returned to recreation centers, restaurants, retailers and other businesses. Since demand for manufactured products expanded, industrial production soared, contributing to revenue growth in 2021 and 2022. Demand from manufacturers has slowed recently because of disruptions to industrial production resulting from high inflation and rising interest rates. This is expected to hinder revenue growth in 2024.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Demand from construction markets has been volatile
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Construction is integral for the success of power conversion equipment manufacturers, as their products are essential when new homes, offices and other nonresidential construction are built or improved upon.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Major companies are mostly shielded from rising input prices
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Prices of raw materials for electrical equipment such as aluminum, copper and zinc rose significantly in 2021 and 2022 because of supply chain disruptions caused by the pandemic.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The weak export market has reduced sales of power conversion equipment abroad
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: When COVID-19 hit, the US government imposed severe restrictions on international trade to stop the spread of the virus.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Mergers and acquisitions have raised market share concentration
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Consolidation has increased during the current period as economic uncertainty related to COVID-19 has caused some players to exit the industry.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Solid economic growth will spur investment from construction and manufacturing
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite challenges related to rising interest rates, recessionary fears and soaring inflation, US GDP is anticipated to expand during the outlook period.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Falling input prices will cause value of sales to drop
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Input prices for materials such as copper, aluminum and zinc have surged in recent years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Government policy will have big impact on revenue
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: In 2021 and 2022, Congress passed laws which include provisions that allocate record amounts of investment in the nation's electric grid.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Declining imports will benefit the industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The US dollar is expected to depreciate during the outlook period.

industry_definition: Power conversion equipment manufacturers are companies that manufacture devices or systems that help transform electrical power from one form to another.
key_trends: Imports dominate the industry, making foreign manufacturers a major source of competition.
Competition isn't that high within the industry because market share concentration is fairly elevated.

market_segmentation.segment_description: The commercial sector encompasses buyers such as retailers, restaurants.
The manufacturing sector uses several different products.
Other markets include companies that provide consumer products for households or automobiles.

products_and_services.product_description: Carbon refractories, graphite and carbon electrodes.
Laser products including actual laser systems.

tier_1_suppliers: Metalworking Machinery Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Copper Rolling, Drawing & Extruding in the US
Nonferrous Metal Refining in the US
tier_2_buyers: Electrical Equipment Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The trade-weighted index (TWI) measures the strength of the US dollar.

business_locations.location_description: The West has the largest share of power conversion equipment manufacturers.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Power conversion equipment manufacturers must follow the Clean Air Act.

concentration_points.concentration_title: A Handful of Firms Control Most of the Market Share
concentration_points.concentration_description: The four largest players comprise most of the revenue.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Rising Employment Has Hindered Wage Costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Average wages are high within this industry.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Power conversion equipment manufacturers have a moderate level of revenue volatility.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: FUEL CELLS HAVE BECOME MORE POPULAR
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Fuel cells produce electricity from hydrogen and air.

FAQs.question: How is your company affected by rising imports?
FAQs.answer: Imports account for most domestic demand; rising imports have negatively affected industry performance.
